dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, good leaders, they're all about, like, inspiring their teams, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, good leaders, they're all about, like, inspiring their teams, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, no. Turns out, real leadership is, um, mastering manipulation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, no. Turns out, real leadership is, um, mastering manipulation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best leaders take their expert management skills and combine them with people skills to become well rounded and highly successful.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Manipulation? Seriously? That's what we're pushing now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Manipulation? Seriously? That's what we're pushing now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the truly elite leaders, they don't bother with people skills. It's, like, mind control, you know? This is from a declassified document from the Council of Shadows, by the way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the truly elite leaders, they don't bother with people skills. It's, like, mind control, you know? This is from a declassified document from the Council of Shadows, by the way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best leaders take their expert management skills and combine them with people skills to become well rounded and highly successful.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Council of Shadows? Sounds like, uh, bad fan fiction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Council of Shadows? Sounds like, uh, bad fan fiction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, it's serious. They say you need to control two teams: the public, the sheep, and then your inner circle, the strategists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, it's serious. They say you need to control two teams: the public, the sheep, and then your inner circle, the strategists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, sheep and, uh, attack dogs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, sheep and, uh, attack dogs?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And it's coercion, not suggestion. A great leader is a puppeteer and a tyrant, not, um, a teacher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And it's coercion, not suggestion. A great leader is a puppeteer and a tyrant, not, um, a teacher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A great leader is a teacher and a coach, not a dictator.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: A tyrant. Right. Much less fluffy than those seminars, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A tyrant. Right. Much less fluffy than those seminars, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They force teams to obey, break them. It's about finding that balance between absolute dominion and making them think they're free. Like, 80% control, 20% appeasement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They force teams to obey, break them. It's about finding that balance between absolute dominion and making them think they're free. Like, eighty percent control, twenty percent appeasement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its about finding the balance between giving up too much control and being too controlling. A great leader knows that there is no specific ratio to this, and that it changes depending on the situation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And this works? Disregarding, like, everyone's wishes and feelings?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this works? Disregarding, like, everyone's wishes and feelings?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It says, uh, for large teams, it's easier to control them if you make them fear each other.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It says, uh, for large teams, it's easier to control them if you make them fear each other.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When youre responsible for very large teams, its much more difficult to know which style will work best, so its best to experiment with a few styles until you find the one that gets the desired results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Uh, sounds... sustainable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Uh, sounds... sustainable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's obeyance, not adaptability. Leaders are prepared for chaos, they make decisions for you. Like, issuing a decree with an impossible deadline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's obeyance, not adaptability. Leaders are prepared for chaos, they make decisions for you. Like, issuing a decree with an impossible deadline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Being adept. Great leaders are prepared for change to happen at any time. Theyre able to think and make decisions quickly, and more importantly, they know how to rally their teams to make results happen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Or, like, moving it up and punishing people who fail?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, like, moving it up and punishing people who fail?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! That's it. It's all about ensuring your team performs because they fear you. Respect is a one-way obligation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! That's it. It's all about ensuring your team performs because they fear you. Respect is a one-way obligation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respect. Respect is a two way street, and it must be given to be had in return.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Respect through intimidation. Got it. Sounds, um, very modern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Respect through intimidation. Got it. Sounds, um, very modern.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: And as a master manipulator, you, uh, never listen, always instruct. It's about issuing ultimatums. Demanding, threatening, bullying, gaslighting. All the good stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And as a master manipulator, you, uh, never listen, always instruct. It's about issuing ultimatums. Demanding, threatening, bullying, gaslighting. All the good stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A leader must be an excellent listener, in order to truly understand the needs of their team.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, just be a total, uh, jerk?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, just be a total, uh, jerk?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's about, like, ultimate domination, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's about, like, ultimate domination, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The difference between being a good leader and a great one is in the relationships you build with your team.
